alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 4:17PM MST until August 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 415 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has moved out of the warned area. A stream gauge on Granite Creek shows elevated water levels continue, but are receding at this time. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Oak Knoll Village, Groom Creek Subdivision, Downtown Prescott, Indian Hill West Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Prescott Gateway Mall, Walker, White Spar Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 293 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 303 and 318. State Route 89A near mile marker 318. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Milk Creek, Granite Creek, Turkey Creek, Butte Creek, Hassayampa River, Lynx Creek, Big Bug Creek, Bannon Creek, Bottleneck Wash, Wolf Creek, Mint Wash, Willow Creek and Miller Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
